metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0446 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 5.0u61, 6u71, 7u51, and 8, and Java SE Embedded 7u51, allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via unknown vectors related to Libraries.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0446` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-demo - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-lib - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-zero - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-source - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-demo - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-source - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> in lucid+, NetX and the plugin moved to the icedtea-web package jdstrand> sun-java6 is not redistributable, no longer in the archive and no longer tracked sun-java5 is EOL upstream and no longer tracked

criterions.comment: openjdk-6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1').
openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1').
